Author: Richard T. Schaefer
Published: digital edition 2013
Publisher: McGraw-Hill 
ISBN: 9780078026720

Reader Required: Adobe Reader, Foxit, Nitro, Adobe Digital Editions

Note: you can access Connect through paid registration on the website. Be sure and ask your instructor for course ID details

Tested on the above readers with no problems on laptop and Android tablet. 
Please allow a couple seconds for the seedboxes to kick in, then it should move pretty quick. Hope it helps in your studies. Go for it! :D
_____________________________________________________________________________________

Unique to this program, Sociology: A Brief Introduction encourages students to take sociology with them in their everyday lives, just as Rick keeps a small notebook of daily sociological events. In Sociology brief, instructors get the most trusted content in manageable form. This, coupled with powerful digital learning tools (paid registration on the Connect website), makes Sociology brief an ideal choice for your introductory course.
